mainSections.name: People
mainSections.description: I have been fortunate enough to work with quite a few amazing and thoughtful people throughout my career, helping each other with our goals and pushing each other to be better versions of ourselves.  We achieve this by fostering a culture of collaboration - a place where people feel comfortable working together and encouraged to share their ideas, no matter who they are or what their role is.  This has been one of the biggest factors of my success and the most important ingredient to any team you'll ever build.

mainSections.name: Process
mainSections.description: Creating efficiencies in the way we work is a never-ending journey but one that’s well worth taking. Over the years I’ve worked with and for some amazing people and organizations who were early adapters of new methodologies, technologies and ways of thinking about product development. I feel incredibly lucky to have experienced first-hand how effective a team can be with the right processes and approaches to process refinement.

mainSections.name: Technology
mainSections.description: Technology is important, but it's not the only thing that matters. At the end of the day, it's still just a tool. What's more important is how you use that tool. Do you use the same knife to cut everything in your kitchen? Hammers go good with nails, but not with screws. What your teams need is someone who has worked across a lot of technologies. Had their hands dirty and code and configuration and understands the importance of quality and security.
